title: WiFi Security Essentials
description: Master the basics of securing your wireless network.
learning_objectives: Learn to secure your WiFi network
Know how to change WiFi passwords

steps.title: Check Your WiFi Encryption
steps.description: Verify what type of encryption your WiFi network is using.
steps.content:
1. Connect to your WiFi network
2. Open Command Prompt/Terminal
3. Run: netsh wlan show interfaces (Windows) or /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/Apple80211.framework/Versions/Current/Resources/airport -I (macOS)
4. Look for 'Authentication' and 'Cipher'
hints: WPA3 is best, WPA2 is acceptable, WEP is insecure

steps.title: Change WiFi Password
steps.description: Update your WiFi password to something strong.
steps.content:
1. Access your router admin panel
2. Find the WiFi/Wireless settings
3. Change the WiFi password (pre-shared key)
4. Use WPA3 encryption if available
5. Save and reconnect devices

steps.title: Disable WPS
steps.description: Turn off WiFi Protected Setup as it can be vulnerable.
steps.content:
1. In router admin panel, find WPS settings
2. Disable WPS (WiFi Protected Setup)
3. This prevents brute force attacks on WPS PIN

steps.title: Change Network Name (SSID)
steps.description: Change your WiFi network name to something non-identifying.
steps.content:
1. In router settings, find WiFi network name (SSID)
2. Change it from the default (like 'NETGEAR-123')
3. Don't include personal information
4. Save changes
